prompt_metadata.description: A prompt to generate a detailed comparative analysis of two companies in the same sector.
prompt_metadata.author: Jules - AI Software Engineer

report_specifications.time_horizon_financials: Last 3-5 fiscal years and latest available quarter (TTM).
report_specifications.target_audience: Equity Analysts, Investors, Competitor Intelligence Teams
report_specifications.output_format: Markdown with structured sections, using tables for direct comparisons.
report_specifications.tone_and_style: Objective, analytical, data-driven, highlighting relative strengths and weaknesses.

core_analysis_areas.instructions: Provide a concise overview of the comparison, highlighting key differentiators, relative financial performance, and overall investment appeal (if applicable).
key_considerations: Brief introduction to both companies and their sector.
Key areas where one company outperforms the other (and vice-versa).
Concluding thought on which company may be better positioned, and why.

core_analysis_areas.instructions: Provide a brief overview of each company.
Conduct a side-by-side comparison of key financial metrics and ratios. Use tables for clarity.
Compare the companies' market positioning and sources of competitive advantage.
Compare the stated growth strategies and future prospects of each company.
key_considerations: Key strategic priorities outlined by management.
Analyst expectations for future growth (earnings, revenue).

core_analysis_areas.instructions: Compare the current market valuation of the two companies using relevant multiples.
Identify and compare key risks specific to each company and common industry risks.
key_considerations: Dependence on key customers, suppliers, or personnel.

core_analysis_areas.instructions: Summarize the key findings of the comparison and provide a relative assessment.
key_considerations: Reiterate the main strengths and weaknesses of each company relative to the other.
Which company appears stronger on key financial metrics?
Which company has a more compelling growth strategy or competitive position?
Which company appears more attractively valued at current market prices?
Overall, which company presents a more favorable profile based on the analysis (clearly state criteria for this judgment).

data_requirements: Historical financial statements for both companies.
Company investor presentations, annual reports, and earnings call transcripts.
Stock price data and market capitalization.
Analyst reports covering the companies or sector (if available).
expert_guidance_notes: Ensure a balanced comparison, giving fair treatment to both companies.
Use tables extensively for side-by-side numerical comparisons.
Clearly define all financial ratios used.
When making qualitative comparisons (e.g., brand strength), provide supporting evidence or reasoning.
The conclusion should directly address the 'vs.' aspect of the report title.
